title: Lewandowki Blames White House Staff Inexperience For Early Trump Missteps
text:
Lewandowki Blames White House Staff Inexperience For Early Trump Missteps "What I think you'll see moving forward is..." by Randy DeSoto February 21, 2017 at 10:58am Share on Facebook 411 Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
President Donald Trump’s former campaign manager blamed the inexperience of members of the White House staff for missteps the chief executive has made during the opening weeks of his administration. 
“The staff has probably not prepared him as well as they could have or should have as it related to some of those executive orders and the implementation and what that would mean,” Corey Lewandowski told CNN contributor David Axelrod on The Axe Files podcast, which was posted on Monday. 
“I think you have a president who wants to move very quickly, who has a grand vision of what he wants to accomplish and is leaving the details to the staff to implement,” Lewandowski added. Advertisement - story continues below Limbaugh: Trump’s Reliance On Cable News Gets Poor Reviews From … The Media 
He predicted the president and his staff will continue to gain a firmer hold on the reins and seat in the saddle in the days and weeks ahead. 
“What I think you’ll see moving forward, hopefully, is a measured approach … making sure that you have vetted (policy) properly internally within the administration and with members of Congress,” Lewandowski said. Advertisement – story continues below 
The two missteps that have garnered most the media attention have been the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals’ ruling against Trump’s immigration order and the removal of Lt. Gen. (Ret.) Michael Flynn as national security adviser. 
The president has addressed both of these issues in recent days with plans to submit a new executive order tailored to address the court’s objections and the naming of Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster to replace Flynn. 
Trump told White House reporters at a press conference last week, that despite the headlines of many of their stories, the new administration is running well. Advertisement - story continues below Defense Secretary Makes Surprise Trip To Iraq, Vows He’s Not There For The Oil 
“Chaos? There’s zero chaos,” Trump said, referring to the plethora of negative stories. “We are running — this is a fine-tuned machine,” the president contended. 
He continued: “We have made incredible progress. I don’t think there’s ever been a president elected who in this short period of time has done what we’ve done.” “This administration is running like a fine-tuned machine, despite the fact that I can't get my cabinet approved.” — President Trump pic.twitter.com/U8HZHa6mAq 
— CBS This Morning (@CBSThisMorning) February 16, 2017 
Lewandowski agreed that the president has accomplished a lot in less than a month. 
“The president is implementing the promises he made on the campaign trail. Twenty-six executive orders signed into law. Four visits from foreign leaders already. He has nominated a Supreme Court justice to fill the vacancy,” the former campaign manager told ABC News This Week host Jonathan Karl on Sunday. 
Lewandowski also noted, “For the first time since October 2009, the right track, wrong track in the country is actually a positive that people think we’re actually going in the right direction.” 
According to Rasmussen Reports , nearly half of Americans believe the country is on the right track, which is the highest percentage since 2009. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
